title: Science Terminology Acquisition Process Based on Active Response Error Correction for Audiovisual Word Education

context.prior_knowledge: Lack of foundational science terminology understanding and recognition of workplace-specific jargon necessity
context.additional_context: Learners are office/administrative professionals requiring enhanced scientific report writing and communication skills. Blended delivery with personal device-enabled online learning and face-to-face sessions.

learning_goals: Learners can read 40 core science terms with 80% accuracy within 4 weeks through audiovisual materials (images/videos/texts)
Learners can apply an active response correction procedure (teacher modeling → learner repetition) to correct errors immediately in over 90% of error scenarios
Learners can utilize trained terminology with over 70% accuracy at the sentence level (science report samples)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
